se.fnord.jamon

Class NodeMatchers

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.fnord.jamon.NodeMatchers

  • public class NodeMatchers
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility to verify parse trees

      • children

        public static NodeMatcher children(NodeMatcher... matchers)
        Verifies the child nodes. The number of children must be equal to the number of supplied NodeMatchers.
        Parameters:
        matchers - The matchers to use when verifying children
        Returns:
        the constructed NodeMatcher

      • and

        public static NodeMatcher and(NodeMatcher... matchers)
        The conjunction of zero or more NodeMatchers. Passing no NodeMatchers creates a NodeMatcher that always return true.
        Parameters:
        matchers - The matchers whose results should be and:ed together
        Returns:
        the constructed NodeMatcher

      • or

        public static NodeMatcher or(NodeMatcher... matchers)
        The disjunction of zero or more NodeMatchers. Passing no matchers creates a matcher that always return false.
        Parameters:
        matchers - The matchers whose results should be or:ed together
        Returns:
        the constructed NodeMatcher

      • node

        public static NodeMatcher node(java.lang.Object attachment,
               java.lang.String value,
               NodeMatcher... matchers)
        Verifies the attachment, value and children of a node. Equivalent to:

        and(attachment(attachment), value(value), children(children))

        Parameters:
        attachment - The object to check for equality with the node attachment
        value - The object to check for equality with the node value
        matchers - The matchers to use when verifying children
        Returns:
        the constructed NodeMatcher

      • empty

        public static NodeMatcher empty()
        Verifies that a node is empty, i.e. has no value, attachment or children
        Returns:
        the constructed NodeMatcher

      • match

        public static boolean match(NodeMatcher matcher,
            Path path)
        Execute a node matcher on a Node path
        Parameters:
        matcher - matcher to execute
        path - Nodes describing the path to the node where the matcher should start.
        Returns:
        true if the matcher succeeds, false otherwise.

      • findFirstDF

        public static Path findFirstDF(NodeMatcher matcher,
               Path path)
        Find the first node matching the matcher using a depth first search.
        Parameters:
        matcher - matcher to execute
        path - Nodes describing the path to the root of the sub-tree to search.
        Returns:
        the first matching node found.

      • findFirstBF

        public static Path findFirstBF(NodeMatcher matcher,
               Path path)
        Find the first node matching the matcher using a breadth first search.
        Parameters:
        matcher - matcher to execute
        path - Nodes describing the path to the root of the sub-tree to search.
        Returns:
        the first matching node found.
